content:
Based on the 9 interviews regarding AR use in marketing, we can identify the following attributes, benefits, and consequences from a means-end theory perspective:

Attributes:

* User-friendly
* Detailed product information
* Interactive
* Privacy
* Cost
* Adoption

Benefits:

* Enjoyment
* Immersion
* High engagement
* Visual appeal
* Usability
* Easy to use
* Customization
* Real-time feedback

Consequences:

* Increased cost
* Privacy concerns
* Low adoption

These attributes, benefits, and consequences are all linked through direct and indirect connections, forming a hierarchical value map (HVM) as shown in previous responses. The HVM provides a means to understand how each attribute, benefit, and consequence is connected and how they contribute to achieving the end goal of an improved experience for the customer.
